Mobileer Instrument Editor

Renaming Files and WaveTables

Once you have measured the pitch, you may want to rename the wave file and associated wavetables to contain the pitch. For example you might rename "Clarinet_n1.aif" to "Clarinet_60.aif" if it is a Middle C.

If you are not interested in renaming the sample files or wavetables then skip to the Next page.

Note, you should only do this for wavetables that you have NOT already used in various instrument. Only do this right after measuring the pitch.

  1. Select the wave file in the Audio Editor that you just extracted a wavetable from by single clicking on it.
  2. Select "Rename Matching" item from the Edit menu. This will rename the file and associated wavetables using a string comparison.
  3. If the file is named "Clarinet_n1.aif" and you want to change the Clarinet_n1 to Clarinet_060 and also rename all of the wavetables created from it, then change the top row to read "Clarinet_n1" and the second row to read "Clarinet_060".
  4. Make sure the "Rename Children" box is checked so that the associated wavetables will also be changed.
  5. Click OK. Note that the file and associated wavetables are all changed.
